title: Julie Andrews admits she was too 'stoned' to accept role on Wolf Of Wall Street
text:
She nearly appeared on The Wolf Of Wall Street.

But Julie Andrews has now revealed why she had to turn down playing Margot Robbie's kind-hearted aunt in the Oscar-winning film.

The actress, 84, revealed on Watch What Happens Live she was unable to accept the role because she was 'truly so stoned' after undergoing a recent surgery.

'I was truly so stoned': Julie Andrews has now hilariously revealed why she had to turn down playing Margot Robbie's kind-hearted aunt in the Oscar-winning film

'I do regret it,' she said. 'I wasn't able to do the movie. I had an operation. I'm a bionic woman and I have a titanium ankle.'

'I was truly so stoned from all the drugs that I had to take to take the pain away,' she added. 'Really, it was mostly the anesthetics.'

Julie still wishes she was able to appear in the film and work with director Martin Scorsese.

'I just wasn't ready and I wanted to be and I would've loved to work with Scorsese,' she added.

What could have been: Andrews was being considered for the role of Aunt Emma, which ultimately went to Joanna Lumley

It's a hit! The Wolf Of Wall Street was released to critical acclaim in 2013 and starred Leonardo DiCaprio as Jordan Belfort

Julie was being considered for the role of Aunt Emma, whose niece Naomi Lapaglia (Robbie) was married to Jordan Belfort (Leonardo DiCaprio).

Ultimately, actress Joanna Lumely took the role.

Julie also addressed a potential Princess Diary 3, after Anne Hathaway admitted a script existed.

'I just wasn't ready': Andrews spoke about her desire to be in the film while appearing on the show with Andy Cohen and Whoopi Goldberg

Julie played Queen Clarisse Renaldi in both The Princess Diaries and The Princess Diaries 2: Royal Engagement, but seemed truly surprised to hear about the script after a caller asked her to weigh in on the film.

'The truth is I haven't heard,' she said. 'But, there's been talk about it for quite a while. I think she has had, or is having a second child, and she's busy and I've been busy, and I think if it happens it'll be lovely, and if it doesn't, I won't have known about it!'

Indeed, Anne is currently expecting her second child with husband Adam Shulman.

News to her! Andrews seemed truly surprised to hear a Princess Diaries 3 script existed after a caller asked her about the film

Julie has been doing the press rounds lately in promotion of her new memoir, Home Work: A Memoir of My Hollywood Years, which is out now.

While doing press for the book, the actress talked candidly about undergoing therapy following the end of her first marriage to Tony Walton.

'I went and got into it and it saved my life, in a way,' she said on The Late Show With Stephen Colbert.
description: The 84-year-old actress revealed on Watch What Happens Live she was unable to accept the role because she was 'truly so stoned' after undergoing a recent surgery.
